issue.title: Safe Fields validation in Sentry
issue.body:
Follow up to #2610

Making the safe fields option in sentry more powerful means also we should validate those rules directly in Sentry and give the user feedback whether their rules are correct (at least syntactically).

review.body:
@phacops any idea how much extra load this will cause? IIRC the avg. number of spans per transactions is ~20, so I guess a 5% increase in load should be manageable.

Please add a PR description so we can later figure out why this change was made at this point in time.

pull_request.title: feat(feedback): add User Feedbacks as Events
pull_request.body:
Relay changes for the revamped User Feedback feature. User Feedbacks (Known as `UserFeedbackV2`), will be events that flow through our system instead of attachments. See [here](https://www.notion.so/sentry/User-Feedback-Beta-11d68db039bc436bae017ad56c0c20f9?pvs=4) for more information on the tech spec (and the link at the bottom for what we do once they're ingested).


Note that within this code, we're calling it `UserReportV2`. This is to avoid confusion with the existing `UserReport`. A PR to shim the previous `UserReports` as new `UserReportV2`'s will follow, at which point we'll rename this in the code to be `UserFeedback`. The string `feedback` is used for the context and ItemType / EventType parsing.

- [x] Adds a feature flag for ingest `UserReportV2Ingest`. This is backed by options https://github.com/getsentry/getsentry/issues/11573
- [x] Creates a new EventType `UserReportV2`
- [x] Creates a new ItemType `UserReportV2`
- [x] Creates a new DataCategory `UserReportV2`
- [x] Adds a new context `UserReportV2Context` that for now contains two properties, `contact_email` (no pii stripping), and the `message` which contains the feedback text.

comment.body: nit: Why did you move the warning to `relay-profiling`? Is it to know the difference between an error in minimum profile parsing and an error in sample parsing? For that, we could also use separate `ProfileError::InvalidMinimalJson` and `ProfileError::InvalidSampleJson`. That way, we could remove the `relay-log` dependency again.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -772,4 +819,93 @@ LIMIT 1
             assert_eq!(sql_action_from_query(query).unwrap(), expected)
         }
     }
+
+    #[test]
+    fn test_display_times() {
+        let json = r#"
+            {
+                "type": "transaction",
+                "platform": "javascript",
+                "start_timestamp": "2021-04-26T07:59:01+0100",
+                "timestamp": "2021-04-26T08:00:00+0100",
+                "transaction": "foo",
+                "contexts": {
+                    "trace": {
+                        "trace_id": "ff62a8b040f340bda5d830223def1d81",
+                        "span_id": "bd429c44b67a3eb4"
+                    }
+                },
+                "spans": [
+                    {
+                        "op": "before_first_display",
+                        "span_id": "bd429c44b67a3eb1",
+                        "start_timestamp": 1597976300.0000000,
+                        "timestamp": 1597976302.0000000,
+                        "trace_id": "ff62a8b040f340bda5d830223def1d81"
+                    },
+                    {
+                        "op": "ui.load.initial_display",
+                        "span_id": "bd429c44b67a3eb2",
+                        "start_timestamp": 1597976300.0000000,
+                        "timestamp": 1597976303.0000000,
+                        "trace_id": "ff62a8b040f340bda5d830223def1d81"
+                    },
+                    {
+                        "span_id": "bd429c44b67a3eb2",
+                        "start_timestamp": 1597976303.0000000,
+                        "timestamp": 1597976305.0000000,
+                        "trace_id": "ff62a8b040f340bda5d830223def1d81"
+                    },
+                    {
+                        "op": "ui.load.full_display",
+                        "span_id": "bd429c44b67a3eb2",
+                        "start_timestamp": 1597976304.0000000,
+                        "timestamp": 1597976306.0000000,
+                        "trace_id": "ff62a8b040f340bda5d830223def1d81"
+                    },
+                    {
+                        "op": "after_full_display",
+                        "span_id": "bd429c44b67a3eb2",
+                        "start_timestamp": 1597976307.0000000,
+                        "timestamp": 1597976308.0000000,
+                        "trace_id": "ff62a8b040f340bda5d830223def1d81"
+                    }
+                ]
+            }
+        "#;
+
+        let mut event = Annotated::<Event>::from_json(json)
+            .unwrap()
+            .into_value()
+            .unwrap();
+
+        extract_span_tags(
+            &mut event,
+            &Config {
+                max_tag_value_size: 200,
+            },
+        );
+
+        let spans = event.spans.value().unwrap();
+
+        // First two spans contribute to initial display & full display:
+        for span in &spans[..2] {
+            let tags = span.value().unwrap().sentry_tags.value().unwrap();
+            assert_eq!(tags.get("ttid").unwrap().as_str(), Some("true"));
+            assert_eq!(tags.get("ttfd").unwrap().as_str(), Some("true"));
comment.body: @shruthilayaj spans that contribute to initial display also contribute to full display. Does that make sense?

pull_request.title: test(spool): Use temporary directory
pull_request.body:
The test `create_spool_directory_root_path` creates a couple of local files: `spool.db`, `spool.db-wal`, `spool.db-shm`.

This PR introduces a test utility to use a separate, temporary directory for this test that automatically cleans up regardless of the test outcome.

#skip-changelog

commits.message: release: 23.10.0
Merge branch 'release/23.10.0'
docs(normalization): Add docs and fix typos (#2612)

deps: bump docker debian images from buster (10) to bookworm (12) (#2622)

- update the base Debian image used in our Dockerfiles from Buster (10)
to Bookworm (12)
- add custom dependabot configuration to cover Rust, Docker, and Github
Actions dependencies

#2619

remove credentials.json (#2621)

Inactive Relay, but these credentials should not exist in source
control.

build(deps): Bump docker/setup-qemu-action from 1 to 3 (#2624)

Bumps
[docker/setup-qemu-action](https://github.com/docker/setup-qemu-action)
from 1 to 3.

build(deps): Bump actions/github-script from 6.3.3 to 6.4.1 (#2625)

Bumps [actions/github-script](https://github.com/actions/github-script)
from 6.3.3 to 6.4.1.

ref(spans): Stop applying clustering rules (#2616)

We currently still apply scrubbing rules discovered by [the
clusterer](https://develop.sentry.dev/transaction-clustering/) to spans,
but this is effectively dead code, because we decided to scrub HTTP
spans more aggressively a while ago (see details below).

By removing the clusterer-related code, we can simplify a lot.

Note: I'm leaving the span clustering rules in the project config for
now, because there might still be outdated configs that do apply it.

### Details

`apply_span_rename_rules` still gets called, but only if a span has
`op:http*` and it does not have a `description.scrubbed` yet:


https://github.com/getsentry/relay/blob/e188c586f81a641a00596a7b39ff87802e835e77/relay-event-normalization/src/normalize/span/description/mod.rs#L239-L240


https://github.com/getsentry/relay/blob/e188c586f81a641a00596a7b39ff87802e835e77/relay-event-normalization/src/normalize/span/description/mod.rs#L261

However, spans with `op:http*` always have a `description.scrubbed`
before calling `span_rename_rules`, because we fall back to a
method-only description:


https://github.com/getsentry/relay/blob/e188c586f81a641a00596a7b39ff87802e835e77/relay-event-normalization/src/normalize/span/description/mod.rs#L131-L133
test(inbound-filters):Add some tests for the real health-check globs (#2615)

feat(normalization): Reject stale events (#2613)

There are some cases where events with stale timestamps reach Relay.
Relay doesn't perform full normalization on these and forwards them,
causing issues in later parts of the pipeline. This PR introduces a new
processor to deal with these timestamps, rejecting events with old
timestamps as a first step.

feat(server): Add aggregator to `Project` to buffer metrics for uninitialized projects (#2588)

#2083 

Puts an aggregator in the `Project` struct where we buffer metrics if
the project has yet to receive a `ProjectState`.

Open question:
* If a project expires without having received a projectstate, this pr
would drop the metrics. Should we also send those to the aggregator?

---------

Co-authored-by: Oleksandr <1931331+olksdr@users.noreply.github.com>

ref(metrics): Add metric for intobuckets (#2630)

we need this to verify the new MetricsBuffer  (#2588)
feat(globalconfig): Only report upstream errors after elapsed interval (#2628)

doc(spans): Document unused span rules (#2626)

Just a quick follow-up to #2616
fix(spans): Restrict resource spans to script, css and link (#2623)
feat: Add support for X-Sentry-forwarded-for header (#2572)

ref(crons): Partition monitor check-ins by monitor slug (#2496)

This change will group check-ins beloning to the same monitor into the
same partition.

This is valuable since it will help to better grantee the ordering of
check-ins during processing. Though by no means does this solve all
ordering issues

#skip-changelog

---------

Co-authored-by: Joris Bayer <joris.bayer@sentry.io>

build(deps): Bump rustix versions (#2633)

Bumps versions to following:

- rustix `v0.37.3` -> `v0.37.25`
- rustix `v0.38.3` -> `v0.38.8`
feat(profiling): Add `platform` field to profile frames (#2629)

feat(spans): Scrub random strings in resource spans (#2614)

These PR attempts to sanitize some flaws in resource span scrubbing:

1. `chrome-extension://` domains are random strings, scrub those.
2. Keep the schema, but scrub subdomains (instead of `cdn.domain.com`,
write `https://*.domain.com`).
3. Replace path segments with special characters (`=`, `%`, ...) with
`*`
4. If a path segment has more than 25 characters after regex scrubbing,
assume it is an identifier and replace with `*`.
5. If a path segment has only alphabetic characters and contains
uppercase characters, assume it is an identifier and replace with `*`.

See test cases for examples.
convert exclude fields into selector

tests: Configure retries with backoffs for requests (#2660)

It seems like sometimes we cannot properly establish connection to the
mini sentry, and failing.

This PR adds `Retry` config with back off to try to mitigate this issue.

pull_request.title: tests: Configure retries with backoffs for requests
pull_request.body:
It seems like sometimes we cannot properly establish connection to the mini sentry, and failing. 

This PR adds `Retry` config with back off to try to mitigate this issue.

Example of a failing job https://github.com/getsentry/relay/actions/runs/6663221361/job/18108771404

Follow-up for #2643 

#skip-changelog
